results.title: Frances
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Sanger, EMI/Parlophone, Brooksfilms and Graeme Clifford
results.brief_description: This is the story of Frances Farmer, whose troubled life made headlines in the 1930s. At 16, she was an award-winning high-school student in Seattle and at 23, a rising, provocative star of stage and screen, admired for her beauty and talent. At 27, a chain of relatively insignificant events led to her arrest and involuntary committal to a mental institution. Jessica Lange delivers a powerful, harrowing performance as the tormented Frances.

results.title: France: the Rhone Valley
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the varied physical, human and economic geography of the Rhone lowlands and emphasises the extent to which the people of this region are dependent on the river. The varied character of the relief, climate and agriculture of the enclosed plains south of Lyons, of the Carmargue, Languedoc and the Crau is shown in stages. The importance of the river as a source of irrigation water and power and the use of the valley as a transport route are stressed.

results.title: France: soaring with the senses. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Fast moving action and adventure as press attache Marie Francoise Guichard shows off the delights of France. Features a barge trip along the Canal du Midi, a journey by France’s latest triumph of technology to Corsica, a hot air balloon flight across the chateaux of the Loire Valley, Bastille Day celebrations in Paris with military parades and concerts, culminating in a climb up Mont Blanc and a parapente flight through the French Alps. Features characters such as Maurice Herzog and Paul Bocuse.

results.title: France: background for literature
results.brief_description: Recaptures the France of the stories of Hugo, Balzac, Maupassant and Poe. Showing scenes in Paris, Versailles, Fountainbleau, Orleans, Chateau d’If, Marseilles and Normandy, the film provides a background for existing literature but does not attempt to recreate the actual scenes of stories.

results.title: France panorama. [Special edition. 14th July Parade]
results.brief_description: Special edition of France Panorama about Bastille Day, as it was celebrated from the turn of the 20th century to the current day. Traditionally it is a day for the French to celebrate the storming of the Bastille and a chance to demonstrate their military might. Includes archival news footage from the 1900s, 1930s and 1940s.
